choices.text:
when I was 6, my sister was half my age. Now I am 80. How old is my sister now?
Your sister would be 40 years old because when you were both 6 and she was half your age (3), that means she was 1/2 * 6 = 3 years old. So, if you are currently 80 years old, then it has been 77 years since you were both 6 years old. Now add the number of years between when you were both 6 and now to your sister's current age: 80 + 77 = 157. Since there is no year zero in our counting system, we need to subtract one from that total (since it would be 2019 - 1 instead of just 2019): 157 - 1 = 156 years old.
